description: With 16,000 care home deaths linked to coronavirus, families want to know what went wrong.
title: Coronavirus: Inside story of Spain's care home tragedy
title_page: Coronavirus: Inside story of Spain's care home tragedy - BBC News
maintext: She joined Castillo and Dom¨ªnguez in gathering information. They believed patients with symptoms had not been separated from those without, before the virus spread rapidly through the home. Staff who had been in isolation after falling ill were reportedly not being replaced, while those who continued to work were having to do longer, exhausting shifts. Lacking adequate protection, workers had to make face masks at home. "We were trying to help, our loved ones were there," Dom¨ªnguez said. "Why weren't they being honest with us?"
